clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Perioperative Lidocaine Infusion on Neutrophil Extracellular Trapping
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Perioperative Lidocaine Intravenous Infusion on Neutrophil Extracellular Trapping After Surgery for Stomach Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the effect of perioperative lidocaine infusion on the neutrophil extracellular trapping after minimally invasive surgery for stomach cancer

detailed_description.textblock: To investigate the effect of perioperative lidocaine infusion on the neutrophil extracellular trapping, especially citrullinated histone3, neutrophil elastase, myeloperoxidase

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: serum concentration of NET(neutrophil extracellular trapping)-related biomarker
primary_outcome.description: NET-related biomarker (citrullinated histone3, neutrophil elastase, myeloperoxidase)

secondary_outcome.description: The quality of recovery is assessed using questionnaire. This questionnaire includes 15 items. The score range is from 0 to 150. The higher score means the better quality of recovery after surgery.
The postoperative pain is assessed using numeric rating scale (NRS; 0=no pain, 10=the maximal pain)
The survival of patients is assessed using electronic medical record.

arm_group.description: The study group receives the intravenous 1% lidocaine 1.5 mg/kg bolus followed by 1.5 mg/kg/h during surgery and 1.0 mg/kg/h until 24 hours after surgery (Max.<120 mg/h).
The control group receives intravenous normal saline 0.15 ml/kg bolus followed by 0.15 ml/kg/h during surgery and 0.1 mg/kg/h until 24 hours after surgery.

intervention.description: The participants receive perioperative lidocaine infusion with general anesthesia for gastrectomy.
The participants receive perioperative normal slaine infusion with general anesthesia for gastrectomy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of stomach cancer
- ASA class I-III
- no metastatic disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- hepatic, renal disease
- chronic inflammatory disease, eg. rheumatoid arthritis
- steroid or anti-inflammatory drug medication
- allergies to study drugs
- neuropsychiatric disease
- refusal of participation
- breast feeding or pregnancy
- weight < 40 kg
